ygData.subject: Arbitrary reaction orders
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, Is there a way to introduce arbitrary reaction orders into the kinetic rate expressions ? I tried the following: 1) using the FORD, RORD auxillary

Subject: Arbitrary reaction orders
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=73935432

Hello,

Is there a way to introduce arbitrary reaction orders into the 
kinetic rate expressions ?

I tried the following:

1) using the FORD, RORD auxillary keywords in a chemkin input file and
using
ck2cti to convert the reactions.   ck2cti parses the chemkin input file
but does
not make in modifications to the description of the reaction in the
.cti file

2) manually modify the reaction section of the .cti with the "order"
keyword.  This
is read into the Cantera succsesfully but the reaction rate values are
to small.

I also tried specifying a reaction with non-unity stoichmetric
coefficients:
2 [A] + 3 [B] -> 1 [C] + 4 [D]
which also seemed to foul up the reaction rate calculations.

Also using non integer stoichmetric coefficients in a chemkin input
file
or .cti file is flag as invalid by approriate Cantera utility.

Any suggestions ?

thanks

Dave Huckaby
